newsitem.title: ESTONIA: DVIGATEL EXPECTS TO BREAK EVEN IN 1997 - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DVIGATEL EXPECTS TO BREAK EVEN IN 1997 - REPORT.

text.p: Dvigatel, a major heavy engineering company in Estonia, said it expected to break even in 1997 and forecast an approximate 40 million kroons turnover for the first half of 1997, newspaper Aripaev said on Friday.
The forecast for the first half of 1997 is four times larger than the first half of the previous year, the newspaper added.
The company made a loss of 10 million kroons in 1996.
The main orders for Dvigatel came from a Norwegian shipbuilding plant, Mayer, and the Finnish crane and lift company, Kone, the newspaper added.
